info.title: Elorus Developer API
info.description:
The Elorus developer API enables external applications access the [Elorus platform](https://www.elorus.com) and update organization data programmatically. For example, you may use the API to: - Update your data without interacting with the Elorus user interface - Connect your e-shop / website, automate the invoicing process and synchronize data - Use Elorus as your billing system This portal provides documentation for developers to access and use the Elorus API.

Deprecation warning

You are currently viewing an older version of the API. The Elorus API version 1.0 is no longer supported and will be shutdown on May 01, 2021. Please update your existing applications to use the latest version instead.

API key.description:
To connect to the API one must be registered with Elorus and own an 
**API key**. The API key is bound to a specific user, and therefore
 can be used to perform any action the user can perform within Elorus.
To obtain your key you must contact the Elorus support team. 

The *API key* must be sent on every request through the standard 
`Authorization` HTTP header as follows:

    Authorization: Token <the_token>
API key.name: Authorization

get.description:
Get the list of payments sent.
---

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `title`, `contact__display_name`, `date`.

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Optionally filter by contact ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description: Optionally filter by transaction type. Either `dp`, `ip` or `cnp`

parameters.name: purchase
parameters.description: Optionally filter by bill ID.

parameters.name: creditnote
parameters.description: Optionally filter by credit note ID.

parameters.name: cheque
parameters.description: Optionally filter by cheque ID.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `amount`, `contact__display_name`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards.Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards.Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

post.description:
Create a new payment sent.
---
When adding a new bill or credit note payment that
exceeds the bill due amount, the remaining amount is stored
as "amount in excess" and can be used in future transactions.

**IMPORTANT NOTE:**
You cannot associate a single transaction with multiple
bills or credit notes using this version of the API.
For more information, see the
[payments sent](#tag/cashpayments) section.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

get.description:
Get a single payment sent.
---

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

put.description:
Update a payment sent.
---
Note that you cannot update the bill, credit note or
cheque of the payment. For example, you cannot assign
a bill to a payment after it was created.

When updating bill, credit note or cheque payments,
you will not be able to change the amount, nor the contact.
In addition, the transaction type cannot be modified.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

patch.description:
Partially update a payment sent.
---
The only difference between full & partial update is that the latter
will treat all parameters as optional. You may omit any parameter
in order to keep the old value.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

delete.description:
Delete a payment sent.
---
Deleting a bill or credit note payment may result
in changing the corresponding document's status. For example, if the
bill was marked as 'paid' it will now revert to 'issued' or
'partially paid' (depending on whether other payments exist as well).

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

get.description:
Get the list of contacts
---
All related addresses, phone numbers and email addresses are included
in the response.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `first_name`, `last_name`, `company`, `profession`, `vat_number`, `email__email`, `phones__number`, `addresses__address`, `addresses__city`, `addresses__state`.

parameters.name: letter
parameters.description: Optionally filter by starting letter. Refers to the contact's "display_name."

parameters.name: ctype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by contact type. Either `client` or `supplier`.

parameters.name: profession
parameters.description: Optionally filter by profession.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Optionally filter by company.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `display_name`, `profession`, `vat_number`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-display_name`).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

post.description:
Create a new contact.
---
This endpoint will add a new contact to the specified organization.
Although `first_name`, `last_name` and `company` are not required
fields, at least one of them must be specified for the record
to be valid. The created contact's ID is included in
the response.

Enable / disable client portal access
---
Use this method to allow or revoke access to the client portal
for a specific email address. The contact in question
must be a client (i.e. `is_client` attribute must be `true`).

get.description:
Get the list of credit notes.
---
The response does not include all the credit note details.
To retrieve more information about a specific credit note, use
the [single credit note](#operation/creditnotes_read) endpoint.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `client__display_name`, `documenttype__title`, `sequence__name`, `number`, `notes`, `items__title`, `items__description`.

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type ID.

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the numbering sequence ID.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Optionally filter by draft status. Can be either `1` or `0`.

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is paid or not. Can be either `yes` or `no`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status. Can be either `1` or `0`.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Optionally filter by client ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `documenttype__title`, `client__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `number`, `sequence__name`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards.Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards.Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

post.description:
Create a new credit note.
---
To create a new credit note, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
As far as the PDF rendering is concerned, you must first specify
the template to use
(see the [credit notes description](#tag/creditnotes) above).
You may override most of the template settings through the
`template_settings` group of fields. You may omit (do not sent at all)
any template setting that you do not wish to override.
The same goes for the `terms` and `public_notes` fields as well.

> **Tip:** In most cases you only need to specify the template ID and
> let Elorus initialize the rest template settings.

#### Credit note lines & amounts
The credit note's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the credit note lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

put.description:
Update a credit note.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft credit notes. To
update issued invoices, you should first mark them as draft via
the [partial update endpoint](#operation/creditnotes_partial_update).

When changing the credit note client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/creditnotes_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

patch.description:
Partially update a credit note.
---
Use this action to update the credit note appearance, notes
or change it's draft status. Since this method does
not modify the credit note items and amounts you can always use it
regardless the credit note status. On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/creditnotes_update) is only applicable
to draft credit notes.

Please not that you cannot mark void credit notes as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/creditnotes_mark_void) them first.

get.description:
Get the list of invoices.
---
The response does not include all the invoice details.
To retrieve more information about a specific invoice, use
the [single invoice](#operation/invoices_read) endpoint.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `client__display_name`, `documenttype__title`, `sequence__name`, `number`, `notes`, `items__title`, `items__description`.

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type ID.

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the numbering sequence ID.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Optionally filter by draft status. Can be either `1` or `0`.

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is paid or not. Can be either `yes` or `no`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status. Can be either `1` or `0`.

parameters.name: overdue
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is overdue or not. Can be either `yes` or `no`.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Optionally filter by client ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `documenttype__title`, `client__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `number`, `sequence__name`, `due_date`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards.Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards.Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

post.description:
Create a new invoice.
---
To create a new invoice, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
As far as the PDF rendering is concerned, you must first specify
the template to use
(see the [invoices description](#tag/invoices) above).
You may override most of the template settings through the
`template_settings` group of fields. You may omit (do not sent at all)
any template setting that you do not wish to override.
The same goes for the `terms` and `public_notes` fields as well.

> **Tip:** In most cases you only need to specify the template ID and
> let Elorus initialize the rest template settings.

#### Invoice lines & amounts
The invoice's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the invoice lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

#### Payment gateways
When you create a new invoice, it will be automatically associated
with the default [payment gateways](#tag/paymentgateways) of the
organization (if any), so that the invoice can be paid online.
To modify the invoice's payment gateways, you must use
the [partial update endpoint](#operation/invoices_partial_update).

put.description:
Update an invoice.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft invoices. To
update issued invoices, you should first mark them as draft
via the [partial update endpoint](#operation/invoices_partial_update).

When changing the invoice client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/invoices_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

patch.description:
Partially update an invoice.
---
Use this action to update the invoice appearance, the payment gateways
or change it's draft status. Since this method does
not modify the invoice items and amounts you can always use it
regardless the invoice status. On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/invoices_update) is only applicable
to draft invoices.

Please not that you cannot mark void invoices as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/invoices_mark_void) them first.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `number`, `bank`, `location`, `contact__display_name`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optional filter.

parameters.name: bank
parameters.description: Optional filter.

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Optionally filter by contact ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: pending
parameters.description: Can be either `1` or `0`.

parameters.name: dishonoured
parameters.description: Can be either `1` or `0`.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `issue_date`, `due_date`, `amount`, `contact__display_name`, `bank`, `status`, `location`, `number`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-issue_date`).

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards.Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards.Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `title`, `description`, `code`.

parameters.name: sales
parameters.description: Optionally filter by sales status. Use `1` to retrieve items that can be sold and `0` to retrieve items that cannot be sold.

parameters.name: purchases
parameters.description: Optionally filter by purchase status. Use `1` to retrieve items that can be purchased and `0` to retrieve items that cannot be purchased.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `title`, `sales`, `sale_value`, `purchases`, `purchase_value`, `manage`, `stock`, `code`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-title`).

patch.description:
Partially update a product / service.
---
The only difference between the
[full update](#operation/products_update) and partial update
endpoints, is that the latter will treat all parameters as optional.
Omit any parameter to keep the old value.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

delete.description:
Delete a product / service.
---
If you delete a product that is associated with an invoice line,
the invoice will be decoupled from the product.
Other than that, the invoice line will be left
intact and the product will be successfully deleted.

The same goes for any bills, credit notes etc. associated with
the product.

get.description:
Get the product / service stock history.
---
This endpoint returns the complete list of stock
changes for the specified product / service. Each record
in the response corresponds to an invoice, credit note,
purchase invoice, purchase credit note or stock adjustment
that the product has been associated with.

The endpoint applies only to products with enabled stock management.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `title`, `description`, `code`.

parameters.name: sales
parameters.description: Optionally filter by sales status. Use `1` to retrieve items that can be sold and `0` to retrieve items that cannot be sold.

parameters.name: purchases
parameters.description: Optionally filter by purchase status. Use `1` to retrieve items that can be purchased and `0` to retrieve items that cannot be purchased.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `title`, `sales`, `sale_value`, `purchases`, `purchase_value`, `manage`, `stock`, `code`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-title`).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

post.description:
Create a new supplier credit.
---
To create a new supplier credit, you must first specify the supplier.
If you do not specify a the currency code, the supplier's
default currency will have a higher priority than your base currency.

#### Supplier credit lines & amounts
The supplier credit's initial, net and total amount will
be calculated automatically and their values will depend
on the calculator mode and the line items.

When it comes to the supplier credit's lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

Remember that if you do not care about the details,
you can always just send the total amounts in a single line.

put.description:
Update a supplier credit.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft supplier credits. To
update issued supplier credits, you should first mark them
as draft via the [partial update
endpoint](#operation/purchasecreditnotes_partial_update).

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/purchasecreditnotes_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

patch.description:
Partially update a supplier credit.
---
Use this action to update the private notes or change the status.
Since this method does not affect the line items
and values you can always use it regardless the supplier credit status.
On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/purchasecreditnotes_update)
is only available when the supplier credit is in draft mode.

Please not that you cannot mark void supplier credits as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/purchasecreditnotes_mark_void) them first.

put.description:
When changing the invoice client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/recurringinvoices_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

patch.description:
Partially update a recurring invoice.
---
You may partially change the recurring schedule, the client and
the invoice properties. However, the invoice line items and amounts
cannot be modified via this endpoint.

If you change the client ID and the rest of the client fields
are omitted, their values will also be updated based on
the new client's contact record. For example,
if you do not explicitly specify the
`client_email` parameter, it will be automatically
initialized from the specified contact record.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title is used for your own reference, to help you identify the template.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: The default template is applied to new invoices when no template is explicitly specified and no other template is associated with the invoice client. Out of your templates list, only one can be marked as default.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description:
The template layout. Elorus comes with a fixed library of invoice layouts to choose from. Please visit the web application for more information on what each layout looks like. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
strictStrict
profProfessional
modernModern
classicClassic

parameters.name: variation
parameters.description: The predefined set of colors to use when rendering the template. **This field has been deprecated** in favor of a detailed, more sophisticated color definition mechanism. You are advised **not to update** the `layout` of existing templates, since it might lead to unpredictable results. For new templates, we suggest you send the value `default`, and fine-tune the template appearance via the web application.

transaction_type.title: Transaction type
transaction_type.description:
The transaction type. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
dpOther payment
ipSupplier payment
cnpClient refund

title.title: Reason
title.description: Short description / reason.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

currency_code.title: Currency

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: These notes are displayed on the document's printable form.
public_notes.example: Notes visible on the credit note

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.description:

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

discount_appearance.title: Discount appearance
discount_appearance.description:
Discount column appearance. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0As value
1As percentage
2Hide discount column

hide_client_due.title: Hide client due
hide_client_due.description: Hide client's due amount from the commercial document's printable version.

hide_contact_information.title: Hide client contact info

hide_creator_information.title: Hide creator contact info

hide_payments.title: Hide payments
hide_payments.description: Hide both paid and outstanding amount from the commercial document's printable version.

hide_product_code.title: Hide product code
hide_product_code.description: Hide product code from the document.

hide_vat_table.title: Hide VAT table

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: These notes are displayed on the document's printable form.

converted_invoice.title: Converted invoice
converted_invoice.description: The ID of the generated invoice (if any).

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: These notes are displayed on the document's printable form.

recurring.title: Recurring
recurring.description: ID of the recurring record that created this document (if any).

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Measurement unit
unit_measure.description:

20Man-Hour
21Man-Day
22Man-Month
23Kilowatt hour

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

discount_appearance.title: Discount appearance
discount_appearance.description:
Discount column appearance. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0As value
1As percentage
2Hide discount column

hide_client_due.title: Hide client due
hide_client_due.description: Hide client's due amount from the commercial document's printable version.

hide_contact_information.title: Hide client contact info

hide_creator_information.title: Hide creator contact info

hide_payments.title: Hide payments
hide_payments.description: Hide both paid and outstanding amount from the commercial document's printable version.

hide_product_code.title: Hide product code
hide_product_code.description: Hide product code from the document.

hide_vat_table.title: Hide VAT table
hide_vat_table.description: The VAT table analyzes the amounts of each VAT rate found on the document.

items.description: Line items of an invoice.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value

total.title: Total value

payable.title: Payable

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

items.description: Line items of an invoice.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

items.title: Withholding taxes
items.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

terms.title: Terms & conditions
terms.description: These terms are displayed on the document's printable form.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: These notes are displayed on the document's printable form.

payment_gateways.description: A list of payment gateway IDs that can be used to pay the invoice.

items.title: Payment gateways
items.description: A list of payment gateway IDs that can be used to pay the invoice.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

recurring.title: Recurring
recurring.description: ID of the recurring record that created this document (if any).

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
voidVoid
overdueOverdue

items.title: Payment gateways

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

recurring.title: Recurring
recurring.description: ID of the recurring record that created this document (if any).

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:

partialPartially paid

voidVoid

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

logo.title: Account picture
logo.description:
Upload your company logo, which will be used in various sections of the application (e.g. the report PDF documents).

This logo will not be used in the invoices and estimates you issue; you may organize your invoice logos using templates.

currency_before_value.description: If checked, currency will be displayed before the amount (e.g. $30 instead of 30$)

starting_balance.title: Initial capital
starting_balance.description: Fill in your business's initial capital. It will be taken into consideration in the cash flow report. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

subdomain.title: Subdomain
subdomain.description: A unique URL for the organization. You will be able to login and use the application through that URL.

vat_number.title: Tax ID
vat_number.description: The tax ID of the organization.

contact_display_format.title: Default display format
contact_display_format.description:
How you want your contacts to appear in the contacts page and in all contact / client / supplier selection boxes across the application. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
f l - cFName LName - Company
l, f - cLname, FName - Company
l f - cLname FName - Company
c - f lCompany - FName LName
c - l, fCompany - LName, FName
c - l fCompany - LName FName

address_format.title: Address format
address_format.description: The format in which your company's and your contacts' addresses will be displayed. Predefined placeholders, space characters and ',', '.', '-', '|' are allowed.

calculator_mode.title: Default value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Set how Elorus calculates values in your Estimates, Invoices, Purchases & Recurring documents. This is a default value that you can override for each document. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

draft_auto_numbering.title: Auto-numbering of draft documents
draft_auto_numbering.description: If enabled, Elorus will always allocate a number when creating a new document. Disable this setting if you want your new documents to receive a number only after they're issued.

strict_sequential_numbering.title: Force sequential numbering
strict_sequential_numbering.description: If enabled, invoices & credit notes will only be issued if they follow a valid sequential numbering.

numbering_padding.title: Numbering padding
numbering_padding.description:
The total number of numerals in the document's number (e.g. "005" or "00005"). One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
33 digits
44 digits
55 digits
66 digits
77 digits
88 digits
99 digits
1010 digits

negative_stock.title: Allow negative stock
negative_stock.description: If you disable this option, Elorus will prevent you from invoicing products that are out of stock. The setting applies only to products / services whose stock is managed.

slack_notifications.title: Slack notifications
slack_notifications.description: Send a slack message whenever a new notification is created.

is_slack_enabled.title: Is slack enabled
is_slack_enabled.description: Whether the slack integration is enabled or disabled.

contact_display_format.title: Default display format
contact_display_format.description:
How you want your contacts to appear in the contacts page and in all contact / client / supplier selection boxes across the application. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
f l - cFName LName - Company
l, f - cLname, FName - Company
l f - cLname FName - Company
c - f lCompany - FName LName
c - l, fCompany - LName, FName
c - l fCompany - LName FName

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

issue_date.title: Issue date
issue_date.description: When was the cheque actually issued. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

due_date.title: Due date
due_date.description: The cheque's expiration date (post-dated cheque). Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

issue_date.title: Issue date
issue_date.description: When was the cheque actually issued. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

due_date.title: Due date
due_date.description: The cheque's expiration date (post-dated cheque). Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

calculator_mode.description:

initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

items.description: Line items of an invoice.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

theme.title: Template
theme.description: ID of the template that will be used to render the created invoices.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

start_datetime.title: Start date
start_datetime.description: When should the first invoice be created. Timezone information is included.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: The recurring frequency's interval. Please see the [recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) for more information.

period.title: Period
period.description:
The recurring frequency's period. Please see the [recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) for more information. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
daysDays
weeksWeeks
monthsMonths

end_datetime.title: End date
end_datetime.description: When should the last invoice be created. Leave this blank for the recurring schedule to never expire. Timezone information is included.

last_execution.title: Last execution
last_execution.description: When was the last invoice created. Automatically calculated datetime. Timezone information is included.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount

monthsMonths

due_days.description: Days after the issue date, that a commercial document will be considered overdue. This affects the commercial document's due date. You may leave the field blank if you do not want to apply credit.
